abstract: Unsealed indictments reveal scheme by Brooklyn landlord Frank Campasano and two city housing inspectors to illegally evict tenants from their Bushwick apartments; inspectors Luis Soto and Barry Rice Jr charged Campasano $700 to pretend that tenants were subject to vacate order; revelation is small part of larger bribery investigation involving nearly four dozen city housing and buildings employees, property owners and others.
lead_paragraph: A plot to trick a Brooklyn building’s residents into moving was just one discovery of a bribery and kickback investigation involving city workers and others that resulted in dozens of indictments this week.

headline.main: Landlord Bribed Inspectors in Ruse to Evict Tenants, Prosecutors Say
headline.print_headline: Inspectors Are Charged in Ruse to Evict Tenants

snippet: A plot to trick a Brooklyn building’s residents into moving was just one discovery of a bribery and kickback investigation involving city workers and others that resulted in dozens of indictments this week.

keywords.value: Department of Housing Preservation and Development (NYC)
